The 54-year-old had set sail in April from the Mexican city of La Paz, bound for the tropical French Polynesia, but his catamaran was damaged by bad weather weeks into the 4,000-kilometer journey. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The 2023 Women's World Cup kicks off in Australia and New Zealand on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This year, the football tournament is bigger than ever, with 32 nations competing for the trophy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The United States is the team to watch, aiming to make history with a third consecutive title.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But they are set to face stiff competition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Among them, England stands tall as the reigning European champion, spearheaded by a determined lineup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Joining the charge are football powerhouses Germany and the Netherlands, along with Spain, whose star player Alexia Boudellas makes a triumphant comeback after a nine-month recovery from a ligament injury.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And there's even more to play for, with FIFA tripling the prize money compared to 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The tournament kicks off Thursday with New Zealand facing Norway in Auckland, and Australia playing Ireland in front of a sellout crowd of 80,000 people in Sydney.
